semantic_title: Coding Guidelines for Hemolytic-Uremic Syndrome Associated with Sepsis
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > d. Sepsis, Severe Sepsis, and Septic Shock > 9. Hemolytic-uremic syndrome associated with sepsis

content.full_text: If the reason for admission is hemolytic-uremic syndrome that is associated with sepsis, assign code D59.31, Infection-associated hemolytic-uremic syndrome, as the principal diagnosis. Codes for the underlying systemic infection and any other conditions (such as severe sepsis) should be assigned as secondary diagnoses. (Evidence: pg no: 27, L54-L57)
content.summary: Specific coding instructions for hemolytic-uremic syndrome when associated with sepsis, requiring D59.31 as principal diagnosis with sepsis codes as secondary (Evidence: pg no: 27, L54-L57)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Assign sepsis and severe sepsis codes as secondary diagnoses (Evidence: pg no: 27, L56-L57)
